decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with Dredge cards like Stinkweed Imp, Golgari Thug, and Life from the Loam, allowing you to bring back powerful creatures like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast. By using cards like Cathartic Reunion and Thrilling Discovery to discard cards and draw more, you can set up explosive turns where you bring back multiple creatures at once. The end goal is to overwhelm your opponent with fast, recurring threats while also gaining value from cards like Creeping Chill and Ox of Agonas.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana using elves like Elvish Mystic and Heritage Druid, allowing you to cast powerful spells like Collected Company and Ezuri, Renegade Leader to swarm the board with elf creatures. By utilizing combo pieces like Nettle Sentinel and Elvish Archdruid, along with card draw from cards like Elvish Visionary, you can overwhelm your opponent with a massive army of elves and finish them off with cards like Shaman of the Pack. The deck focuses on generating resources and overwhelming your opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By combining mana acceleration from Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple with disruption tools like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' game plans while maintaining a strong board presence. Additionally, access to powerful colorless planeswalkers like Ugin, the Ineffable and Karn, the Great Creator provide additional threats and utility to push the deck towards victory. The deck's strategy revolves around quickly deploying large threats and disrupting opponents' strategies to secure the win.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through countering spells, removing threats, and drawing cards to gain card advantage. It utilizes a combination of counter spells like Remand and Mana Leak, removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Magmatic Sinkhole, and card draw spells like Opt and Archmage's Charm to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide additional spell recursion and card advantage. The inclusion of Blood Moon also adds an extra layer of disruption against multicolor decks.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. With a strong suite of instant speed spells and versatile threats like Snapcaster Mage and Sprite Dragon, the deck aims to control the game while leveraging the graveyard with cards like Cling to Dust and Drown in the Loch. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the deck to recur low-cost permanents from the graveyard, adding resilience and flexibility to the control strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly reducing their own life total to enable powerful creatures like Death's Shadow and Scourge of the Skyclaves to become massive threats. Using efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, as well as disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while providing a fast clock to win the game. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value and recursion of key cards from the graveyard.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize low-cost, powerful creatures alongside cheap spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent with damage. By combining burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, the deck aims to consistently deal damage early and often. The inclusion of cards like Mutagenic Growth and Clever Lumimancer further enhances the deck's ability to assert early dominance and pressure the opponent effectively.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible using efficient burn spells and creatures with haste. By constantly pressuring the opponent's life total, the deck aims to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize or gain control. With a low mana curve and a mix of direct damage spells and creatures, this deck looks to overwhelm opponents with a combination of speed and consistency.

This deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures, like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also utilizes powerful colorless spells like Karn, the Great Creator and All Is Dust to control the board and lock the opponent out of the game. With a strong mana base using Urza lands and Chalice of the Void to disrupt opposing strategies, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with its aggressive Eldrazi creatures and versatile spells.

The main focus of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly put pressure on the opponent with low-cost, evasive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Sprite Dragon, and Soul-Scar Mage. The deck aims to use cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the board and clear the way for its creatures to deal damage. Stormwing Entity provides a powerful threat in the mid to late game while cards like Light Up the Stage and Serum Visions help maintain card advantage. With a focus on tempo and aggression, this deck aims to end the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck aims to utilize Underworld Breach to continuously cast spells from the graveyard, creating a combo loop with Grinding Station and other artifacts to mill the opponent's deck and eventually win the game. Teferi, Time Raveler provides disruption while Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Monastery Mentor generate value and tokens. The deck is supported by cantrips like Opt and Serum Visions, as well as removal like Path to Exile and Lightning Bolt. The mana base is focused on fetch lands and a mix of basic and shock lands to ensure consistency and flexibility.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble a powerful combination of creatures and equipment cards that allow for explosive plays and quick victories. The key strategy revolves around equipping Colossus Hammer onto creatures like Ornithopter or Memnite, enabling them to deal massive amounts of damage in a single swing. By utilizing cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Puresteel Paladin to search for and equip the necessary pieces, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive playstyle. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds extra value and consistency to the deck.

This deck focuses on filling the graveyard with cards like Golgari Thug and Stinkweed Imp to trigger powerful graveyard effects with cards like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam. By using cards like Life from the Loam to bring back lands from the graveyard and Cathartic Reunion to discard more cards, the deck can quickly build up its graveyard presence. The goal is to quickly set up a powerful board state and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and spells from the graveyard.

This Esper Control deck focuses on utilizing a variety of powerful control spells and card advantage engines to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining their own resources. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and grind out incremental advantages over time. Key cards like Cryptic Command, Snapcaster Mage, and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provide versatility and resilience, allowing the player to adapt to different threats and strategies. The deck excels at outlasting opponents and winning through attrition and incremental advantages.

This deck focuses on using low life totals to its advantage, powering up cards like Death's Shadow and Scourge of the Skyclaves. It also utilizes disruption in the form of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the game. With a mix of efficient removal spells and aggressive creatures, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides a powerful companion option that can provide extra value throughout the game.

The deck aims to control the game through a combination of powerful planeswalkers such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Nahiri, the Harbinger, along with versatile removal spells like Assassin's Trophy and Kolaghan's Command. The deck also utilizes powerful multicolor cards like Niv-Mizzet Reborn and Omnath, Locus of Creation to generate value and card advantage. It utilizes the Bring to Light toolbox to find key spells when needed. The deck also includes a variety of lands to fix mana and ensure smooth gameplay.
